install.name: BlogCal-J1.5
install.author: Andrew Willis
install.description: This module provides a calendar based index to your joomla articles. Articles indexed on the calendar may come from a single section or from all sections. Options are provided that allow the user to control calendar appearance which by default takes on settings from the site template. Appearance options include abbreviations for the month and year, and background highlighting for days that link to content as well as the current day. A demo of this module is available at http://julianna.homelinux.org. Support for this module is available at http://joomlacode.org/gf/project/blogcal/.

param.name: cache
param.label: Enable Cache
param.description: Select whether to cache the content of this module

param.name: moduleclass_sfx
param.label: Module Class Suffix
param.description: A suffix to be applied to the css class of the module (table.moduletable), this allows individual module styling

param.name: mbdivclass_sfx
param.label: div Class Suffix
param.description: A suffix to be applied to the css class of the module (div.h3), this allows individual module styling

param.name: monthname_width
param.label: Abbreviated Month Name?
param.description: Select whether to show abbreviated month name

param.name: year_width
param.label: Year Format
param.description: Select whether to show 2 digit or 4 digit

param.name: secid
param.label: Section ID
param.description: Select which section to show calendar for (Default is all items)

param.name: linkbg
param.label: Link Background
param.description: Background for days, for example #AAAAFF, which have valid number of items listed. These days will be shown as link, hence link background

param.name: currbg
param.label: Current Day Background
param.description: Background for todays date, for example #FFAA55. Takes priority over link Background

param.name: currfontclr
param.label: Current Day Color
param.description: Font Color for todays date, for example #FAFAFA. Takes priority over link Background

param.name: firstdayofweek
param.label: First Day of Week
param.description: Changes the first day of the week, 0=Sunday, 1=Monday, etc.

param.name: monthyearformat
param.label: Month-Year Format
param.description: Changes the format of the month and year, 0=Month-Year, 1=Year-Month
